website_summaries.verdict: If you need a high-quality scanner that will make digitizing and transferring your film strips to your PC as efficient as possible, this model is for you.
pros: Compatible with a wide range of film strip sizes and types
Simple to adjust brightness, color, and other visual settings
cons: This is a fairly pricy film scanner

customer_reviews.title: No setup and works very well
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical of the advertiser's claims because I had spent about $300 converting slides to digital photos with a professional service. After converting about 200 slides with the Kodak Mini Digital Scanner, I don't see any difference in quality between those converted on this device and those converted by the professional service. Very easy to use and an easy to understand manual. I will definitely recommend the device to others.
customer_reviews.author: ripplemaker

customer_reviews.title: Crops Image
customer_reviews.text: I just stared scanning 35mm slides. The scanner is easy to use and the quality is good. I down grated it because it does crop the image. The viewer is pretty much WYSIWYG, so can move the slide back and forth to determent what is cropped from the sides. It also crops the top and bottom, almost equally. My 2 “ slides are standard image size of 23mm x 34mm.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Q

customer_reviews.title: Converting old slides from the 1960 and 70's
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well and was able to work thru several trays of slides. now will tackle the older negatives
customer_reviews.author: Leonard C.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I have converted several hundred slides to tiff in the past week. Some of the slides were my grandfathers and are glass, too thick for the holders, so I slid them in on the bottom slide and and adjusted for placement, worked fine. So far I have no issues aside from not being able to figure out how to use the USB cord to transmit the photos directly to my computer. Using a SD card works, just more steps in the process. I have no problems with the device.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is great for hobbyists. At 14mp, the scans won't look good larger than a 4×6 print, but it's all you need for a photo album or posting online.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Kanaras

customer_reviews.title: POORLY WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS, NO TROUBLE-SHOOTING GUIDE
customer_reviews.text: Extremely time-consuming, not recommended for large amounts of slides. Suddenly stopped saving images and instruction booklet has no list of error messages and how to correct them. Unclear drawings of how to use various attachments. Customer service number is only open M-Th 9-6 and friday only 9 til 1 pm. Not worth the price at all-
customer_reviews.author: Genie in OH

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are useless. But you can figure it out. But chops off the head of your pictures. And any kind of bend in the negatives you have to fight to get it through. If only 2 pictures on a negative have to open up and push through manually. But the case is impossible to open making that a pain. The color is awful and not going to redo the color on every pic. Overall - totally not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned for refund
customer_reviews.text: Pictures appeared too dark and couldn’t be adjusted. Returned for full refund.
customer_reviews.author: B. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't fit slides in very well
customer_reviews.text: I found it very difficult to get the 2nd, 3rd, etc slides in. You are supposed to be able to "slide" the next slide in to push through the previous slide. However, I was damaging them in do so as the casing/frame was too tight. I have standard 35mm slides. Had to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Seale

customer_reviews.title: Simple slide scanner, no bells and whistles
customer_reviews.text: This little scanner is very easy to use, with its own simple software that is not uploaded to one's computer. But it has a very tiny memory and needs an extra SD card. I have not bought one yet, so it can only do 2 slides at a time and then its memory needs to be emptied.
customer_reviews.author: Susan F. Witzell

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t read or record to SD card.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this...it would not read any SD card we put in it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah A. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Hard to do slides
customer_reviews.text: I thought if I tried a slightly higher priced Kodak product I would have better luck. Turns out this is not made by Kodak at all. Made in China, and Kodak brand licensed for branding. There is no precision so after you put the slide in the holder and slide it through you have to jiggle everything around to get it centered for a full frames. That happens with EVERY slide. Didn't even try negatives. Back to a search for something that is made well and has parts that fit! That said, if you only have a few and want to take the time to mess with it, the images are decent.
customer_reviews.author: diver

customer_reviews.title: Tight
customer_reviews.text: It was very hard to slide some of the older slides thru as some were just a touch too large to send thru the tray. Cleaned lens but had small particles on end product. May have been the slides were scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Simkins

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Used this to scan over 1,000 slides. It's easy and the preview window is nice for centering the slides. I had hoped the scan quality would look nice on a tv or computer monitor, but it only looks good at about 5" x 8" on screen. The good thing is that I can finally view the slides again after decades of them sitting in boxes. I popped an 8 GB SD card in the device, scanned a couple hundred slides, and then transferred those images to my hard drive, and later added cloud backup. It was easiest to format the card after each session to make transferring easier.
customer_reviews.author: desoto

customer_reviews.title: KODAK mini digital flim & slie scanner
customer_reviews.text: I have thousands of slides of trips dating back to the 1970's. I would like to get rid of the slides, but don't want to loose the memories. Searching for an answer, a friend told me about this scanner, what a God send. All the slides are in labeled carousels. I have been scanning various trips, saving them on my hard-drive, setting the trips-up into slideshows with back-ground music and watching them on our large flat screen TV. The scanner is easy to us, the colors are fantastic, and I have a long way to go but I am having fun.
customer_reviews.author: Walter G. Carlington

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes when you purchase something based on how it was advertised, when you get the product it doesn't stand up to the description. This product however is amazing and so awesome. I was able to use it without reading every step in the book and the results have been so amazing. We found a box of negatives from the 1970's and were able to convert the negatives to a jpg with simply the push of one button. I didn't realize the product did not come with the media card but as I had one with one of my cameras, this wasn't an inconvenience. Great product, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: EbifKay

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't measure up to my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I found that this device was awkward and not all that intuitive to use. The screen is way too small for any kind of adequate viewing and I was disappointed that I couldn't make it display on my computer monitor. It's not easy to load a slide into the slide holder, either. Scanning my hundreds of slides would've taken way too long, just from how long it takes to get the mounted slide to fit into the holder. So, basically, I felt like it was little more than a toy. I returned it and got the Epson V600, which is a much better option for my needs. I will say returning the product went very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Kathi Somers

customer_reviews.title: Just pay a place to develop your rolls!
customer_reviews.text: First, price: I used to go to a place that for around $8 per roll developed and scanned to CDs my photos, but then I moved. The new local place charges $6 per roll to develop only, and then it's like $18 for medium-quality scans! That's crazy! Five or six rolls scanned at medium, and you could have bought a scanner! Quality: I think the quality is excellent. All my "attached" photos are expired film, so they look busted by design, but it really is the film and not the scanner. I don't know the scanning quality of my local place, but this scanner is at the level of the film scans that I used to get.
customer_reviews.author: Radomir Jordanovic

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to convert several hundred old slides to digital images for the family archive. The slides were 45-50 years old. I was very pleased with the results, given the relatively low price as slide scanners go. It could not have been easier to use. The color in some slides was perfect. The color in most slides needed a little post-scan tweaking, but that’s easy nowadays with the right software. The color in a small handful of slides was so off it just made you scratch your head. Those slides took a lot more post-processing to get them looking okay. All in all, this scanner is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: MFA

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, except not able to download from a 135 slide at 22MP setting and saved only to a quality SD memory card (not saved to to internal memory-) with the scanner connected to the compute with its USB cable. This is supposed to be possible from the instruction manual that came with the scanner. However, if the same memory card is placed in a card reader and its USB cable is connected to the computer, the jpg pictures can be opened from the files on the card. Consequently not a major working problem, just an extra step. If I can get through to customer support, perhaps they can advise further.
customer_reviews.author: fishy guy

customer_reviews.title: Not as clear as my previous slide scanner
customer_reviews.text: There is a very definite difference when comparing my previous slide/film scanner with this scanner and the Kodak scanner does not win the contest. The scanner does not read color very well so each slide had to be adjusted for color and brightness. The scanned photos look dense and rather blurry. I am not pleased with this product, but I have kept it too long to return it. It is fairly easy to use except we never did figure out how to change the preset date so that all of our scans show the year as 1969.
customer_reviews.author: V. Alvord

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, Quanlity?
customer_reviews.text: Scanner is easy to use, but quality of scans are not as expected. Scans of slides and negatives are fuzzy, out of focus, and have gray cast, from sharp, true color slides. The carriers are flimsy, but work. After using Kodak products for decades, I would have expected much better quality from a product "Labeled" Kodak.
customer_reviews.author: Sherman B.

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to scanning old negatives from 30 years ago and bring them to the digital age.The quality of the scan/photo was not an issue,I did not expect enlargement results,just the ability to view on digital equipment.Very easy to set up and learn,not much at all to use. After 41 negatives were processed I got a white screen on the unit,reformatting and putting the memory card in and out did not do anything,no trouble shooting guide.The only thing I can figure out the camera portion of the unit malfunctioned and was no longer able to see or make a image of the negative.I never even took off the protective film cover on the screen
customer_reviews.author: Lucy M.

customer_reviews.title: it does not work well with super8mm film - made primarily for slides and 35 mm negatives
customer_reviews.text: Brought primarily for super 8mm film and that does not work well at all. Did not like that there was no guides for the film holders for each film type. There is no take up real for film either . Product was useless for me
customer_reviews.author: Martin j brick

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner
customer_reviews.text: This little negative scanner is really terrific for 35mm negatives and slides, but is a bit tricky to feed 110 negatives through unless they are at least 4 or 5 pictures in a single strip -- and, sadly, the processors of 110 film were not very careful about that. That said, if you can get the media in place the scans are quite good, and the interface to our PC is very straightforward. I have not attempted 8mm movie media, though it is theoretically possible to scan it -- but into individual JPEGs, not moving pictures.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bruce Meikle

customer_reviews.title: An easy way to convert old negatives to cmputer files
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a memory card to save photos to. I have had this scanner for a week now. Works great. So far have spent 5 hours scanning negatives. Very easy for me to use. Felt like price was positive. My laptop has no USB port for memory cards, so I also had to purchase a memory card reader to plug into my laptop. Very pleased todate. My negatives were from a cheap camera, negatives left in paper bag from store after developing. Pleased with no problems after 1 week.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Schuster

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this purchase. I was able to scan negatives from the early 1950s and capture pictures from my childhood. Easy to load onto phone/computer. I also had old slides from 1980 which scanned beautifully. I would recommend this highly. Also, item was shipped quickly and - a good deal for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok but card reader failed almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: Want to scan a bunch of old 35mm slides. I got the first batch in fine. Removed the SD card to download the photos to my PC. Things felt "funny" when re-inserting the SD card. The card reader no longer works. With no SD card, no photos can be taken. The scan quality on the slides I did capture was OK. Not great. I would rate this a 3 star for ease of use and for scan quality. And, a 1 star for robustness.
customer_reviews.author: Joe N9OK

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner.
customer_reviews.text: I like this little scanner. I bought another brand that I'm returning due to pictures coming out grainy. This one is much better! I like not having to download any software, and love the preview screen. I am not using an SD card, but just saving the picture to my computer. I'm sure that there are others that might be even better and more expensive, but this one does the trick for me.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: I returned the product.
customer_reviews.text: The directions were unclear. The device seemed to be flimsy. The loading of slides was awkward, and the whole process was time-consuming.
customer_reviews.author: Nela G

customer_reviews.title: Functional and easy
customer_reviews.text: This device works reasonably well for the price. It is easy to use, but it doesn't always recognize my memory card. After a few tries it eventually comes around. The clarity of the images is o.k. as is the color saturation for colored images. My b/w images are slightly washed out, but I think that I can correct that with a photo program on the computer. This is the 3d different scanner (the other 2 were Wolverines) that I've ordered in the past 4 weeks, and I'm hoping this one will survive the rigors of digitizing several thousand images. I'm simply going to take it slowly (less than 100 per day) to try to keep it going.
customer_reviews.author: David Cosgrove

customer_reviews.title: Scans microfilms
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to scan 35mm microfilm, and it does the job. The viewer is a bit small, which makes reading folio numbers impossible (some of those numbers are hard to read in the full-size image anyway), but that's really the only issue I have with it. It is easy to use. It comes with a SD card option, as well as multiple plugs adaptors. I just plug the USB port into the computer, scan about 20 frames and upload the batch, then scan some more, and so on. This way I don't need an electrical outlet and a card, and I keep track of what I'm doing. The image quality is good and it has an automatic focus.
customer_reviews.author: Lila Collamore

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy scans for slides or negatives
customer_reviews.text: The product works quick and easy. Need to keep the scan surface clean with the supplied brush. Scanned my entire collection in one day(thousands).
customer_reviews.author: Danny L Pace

customer_reviews.title: Kodak scanner makes scanning slides easy
customer_reviews.text: Like many of you, we have thousands of slides in trays and boxes taking up space on our closet shelves. Here's a great stay-at-home project! All you need is this little scanner, a computer with either an SD slot or a card reader, and away you go! A few tips: scan vertical subjects on their sides to get the whole image, and download batches of photos on your computer after scanning 50 slides or so. If you see lint on your downloaded photos, clean the scanner with Blow-off Duster or other pressured air and just rescan the images.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Thank you, Kodak, for happy memories!
customer_reviews.text: Not only I give to this wonderful Kodak device 5 stars but I also want to thank them for bringing up so many happy memories. Before digital cameras and PCs came around I used Kodak disposable cameras and they also kept me happy for many years. So many negatives accumulated from that time and now, being retired, I decided to organize my photo collection in perfect order. Thanks to Kodak, it was not only a breeze, it was also a thrill and excitement: the scanner brought to a new life some episodes of my life that were not photo printed at the time or the pictures were lost. Can't thank you enough, dear Kodak!
customer_reviews.author: Californian

customer_reviews.title: Pretty freaking good for slides, but not meeting expectations on Super 8
customer_reviews.text: This product works really well for my slides but not so good on my Super8 film.The process is the same, but using the S8 adapter instead. On the screen of the product my films show up very good...but when uploaded to my computer, all the pics are extremely fuzzy to the point where i look like I'm blurred out on a true crime show to protect my identity. (Taking stills of the film). Anyone else have same problem?
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I have a ton of negatives and slides that are just too hard to see without help and this scanner helps me to see what I have. I also like the feature that can digitize a negative or slide so you can print or show it on your computer. There were only a couple things that didn't work for me.... while it worked great for slides and 110 and 35 mm film, I had some taken with a minox camera and it was almost impossible to look at those. Also, the different holders were difficult to load and open and close. But in general it's a great item.
customer_reviews.author: Foxcat

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: My unit shuts off randomly on occasion but a power on restarts right away. A minor inconvenience not worth a serious complaint. I do wish it included the 120 film format. The results are great and quickly converted to JPG which then can be edited with software on your PC/Laptop. Be sure to purchase the recommended SD Card - makes it very convenient transfer images to your PC/Laptop. Works well with color or black and white film.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for quickly viewing and saving 35mm slides. Just insert in slide holder and push through one by one. Saved images were clear and color accurate. Had one question which customer service cleared up quickly. Next edition of instructions should note that SD card need not be formatted if purchased with formattting, and needs to be inserted in scanner “upside down” I.e. with contacts facing up.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W

customer_reviews.title: Great clarity, easy to operate  and so small!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the scanner about a week and absolutely love being able to get my dad old slides from around 1960 when he was in military and traveled Europe. I have scanned about 400 slides so far. I am really happy about this product and can’t wait to scan more slides and negatives
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Flagg

customer_reviews.title: Easy manual loading of slides
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only used this to digitize my slides (completed about 500 as of today) and will update later after I try converting my photo negatives and Super 8 film. Am really happy with this since it gives good quality and I estimate that I have recoop the cost (versus doing conversions thru commercial source). Likes: Easy loading of the slides, ability to rotate slides before saving. Dislikes: Process of changing the brightness of each slide is not clearly explained in instructions.
customer_reviews.author: SKA49

customer_reviews.title: Extremely handy tool
customer_reviews.text: I found the Kodak film/slide scanner to be an excellent product for the price. It is incredibly easy to use and does the job it is designed to do. If you have slides or negatives that you want to digitize, this product is for you. Everything can be store on a simple memory card so it doesn't matter if you have a Mac or PC. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: George Stockwell

customer_reviews.title: Product performs as described.
customer_reviews.text: I had 700+ 35 mm slides to scan. I found this product as the solution to my problem. It is easy to utilize and scans well. The only two drawbacks I found were: 1. At times it will crop the picture and you cannot get the entire picture in a scan. 2. Be extra careful with the lint / hair / dust flying around in the environment. I had some get onto the machine and did not realize it until having over 200 slides scanned. So periodically pay close attention to your scanned results and clean the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read instructions first.
customer_reviews.text: When memory of unit and/or chip is used up, a warning sign appears on the screen. My warning sign said "PULL", which made no sense to me. Assumed it meant "FULL", but there is no mention of this warning sign listed in the instruction booklet I got with the item. Great unit, otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: CDRUSN4100

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: I came across old negatives and wanted to get the images scanned to my computer. I’ve used professional scanners in the past in my previous job in a photography studio. This neat, compact negative scanner is scanned 37 frames in less than an hour. I blew off my negatives with an air can and the images were perfect. I like how you can choose color or black and white. I used both functions with ease. I’m very happy with this product as an inexpensive home scanner. As someone who has professionally scanned negatives and then worked with images digitally, this is an excellent buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: erikab3

customer_reviews.title: It was too tedious to convert slides
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for friend. It was too time consuming to do. They had alot of slides to convert.
customer_reviews.author: L M C

customer_reviews.title: Saved me a lot of money
customer_reviews.text: Had over 300 35mm slides that had not been viewed for decades and were about to be thrown away because we didn't have a projector any longer. Decided to try this rather than send my slides in to have them digitized. Simple to use, although one slide at a time makes it a labor of love. Digitized all 300 slides and had the chance to relive wonderful memories. I had no issues with the unit and very happy with the quality of the digital pictures.
customer_reviews.author: jtk

customer_reviews.title: Basic unit but worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Since I converted to a Digital SLR I needed to convert about 2000 slides to a digital format. Did not want to spend a lot because my use would be limited. The unit works well. Scans are actually of good quality. Scans are fast and the the feature that would make this better would be the ability to save directly to my computer. You have to transfer photos from the internal memory or an SD card. The card does not come with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Paveglio

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to be able to buy this scanner, as I've long wanted to convert my slides to digital. What a disappointment! First I tried with negatives. The image was spotty and color was poor. Since what I wanted was to scan slides, I went on to them next. Tried several slides from various groups. They all scanned like negatives, with the color reversed. Even without the right colors, I could tell that the scans were not crisp and I suspect the color wouldn't be any better than with the negatives. Try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy to use right out of the box. Exceeded my expectations. Scanned and saved 500 negatives in about 4 hours.
customer_reviews.author: David Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted. It is so easy to use and the photos come out much better than I had anticipated from slides that date back to early 1970s. Newer slides produce even better photos. I highly recommend this slide and film scanner to anyone who has slides or negatives and wants to convert them to digital photos. It works, isn't complicated to use, and does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Delta Dawg

customer_reviews.title: It works if you take time to learn it
customer_reviews.text: Yes it scans slides and negatives. Takes a bit of learning to get satisfactory results but it does the job. It saves the images to an SD card which you must them connect to a computer--no direct connection from the scanner to your computer is possible. I downloaded the manual from the Internet. Worth it if you don't have a huge number of slides or negatives to scan. Portrait images should be scanned in landscape mode and then rotated in your computer or it will cut off top & bottom. Also, remember to redate the imades after they are on your computer if you want them properly dated.
customer_reviews.author: Joel W. Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Scanned approx. 100 slides and many Super 8 Movies. The scanned results were then uploaded to an Apple iMac. Product worked pretty well. Picture scan quality was fair considering the quality of the original. The one drawback to my overall satisfaction with the scanner is the user manual. The instructions are a little “sparse”. Several important steps are not covered adequately. Other than that, it a pretty good product.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace Miskimon

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy Design
customer_reviews.text: Super 8 adapter flopped around in the carrier, unable to get a full image due to some type of shadow on one side. I purchased Kodak because I expected quality. Returned iten without being able to get a single scan.
customer_reviews.author: H.R. Everett

customer_reviews.title: Give it a try
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed at first with this unit but after speaking with the distributor on the phone and through emails, the customer service they provided was outstanding. We decided it is more than likely a defective unit, and they are replacing it. I will try it again. I have high hopes for a quality Kodak product as I have for years, and I'm convinced it will work perfectly for me. The customer service is second to none.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Scanning is quick and easy with this scanner
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to scan slides (that is all so far I have done). Setting are quite easy, and you can scan several slides each minute. The hardest part is that the slides have to be cleaned quite well - the scanner will pick up dust and other imperfections - it is very sensitive (that is a positive thing). I am glad I purchased this one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anderson

customer_reviews.title: It scans my slides fine.
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have scanned about 400 slides. It has worked fine. I have printed some of them and they look great. I have not tried negatives, yet. Looking forward to it.
customer_reviews.author: lmprtodd

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and good quality scans
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to use for both slides and negatives. I liked how I could feed them through without having to do it individually. The quality of the scans was also excellent. I did almost 1,000 slides in just a couple days. I will say that now that I have scanned all my slides and negatives that I will be selling the unit to someone because I no longer need it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy B

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for ma
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my 73 year old mom as a Christmas gift. She was able to figure out how to use it on her own -- SCORE! She loves it and has been lost down memory lane for weeks scanning negatives to digital. She lives a long distance away, so I haven't actually seen this machine in action, however she is content with the quality and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: cajuncheeze

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk returning
customer_reviews.text: I have scanned slides, negative etc for years. This unit is cheaply made and I found it difficult to use. Not to mention the fact that the slides have beautiful color but when inserted into scanner, it was yellow. And loading without removing the slide adapter as the "how to" booklet indicated was a joke. Perhaps this unit is defective, but I'm returning and not willing to try out a new unit.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Scanner was as described and in very good condition. Small screen made viewing a challenge. So we viewed the slides using a projector, then scanned the slides we wished to keep and saved those onto an sd card. SD card is not included. The scanner was very easy to operate and scanned the slides quickly. Nice little scanner for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tippytin

customer_reviews.title: basic but reliable
customer_reviews.text: I am reviewing a replacement product. The first one I received was defective and I had to send it back. Replacement was very prompt and easy. The scanner works as expected, but the quality of the digital images is average. You can play with colors, and the pixel size is as stated, but the image still looks noisy, sometimes pixellated. I did not have a chance to compare it with other similar products, but I had higher expectations because I compared with professionally scanned negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Svetlana Savranskaya

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to view some old family slides and negatives & this was perfect. I'm not one to fuss over photo quality but was amazed at how good the slides transferred to jPeg format. Also worked well for the negatives - you could view them and the slides on the device itself or on your TV or your laptop. I used my MacBook to transfer and it was quite simple. Worth the price for a do it yourself project.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: What a great device!! I have run a couple of thousand slides through this unit and I can't say enough good things about it. It will scan as fast as I can push the slides through it. All of the Carousel slide trays that have been hiding in the cellar for years I can get rid of and just look at the photos anytime without getting a screen and projector out. It is easy to share pictures with the kids on line. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: CFO

customer_reviews.title: Reliving memories
customer_reviews.text: The KODAK Mini Digital Film & Slide Scanner lives up to its name and does what it says it will do. It is easy to use. I have had fun recovering well over 200 photos to date, and reliving memories as I do. My criticisms are few. Over all, it is a little "plasticky", it feels cheap. The guide for the film sometimes allows the film to slide off skewing the image, or it won't let the film feed through. It also sometimes flickers as if there is a loose connection. The seller delivered on time as promised. Overall, I'm pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to digitize slides my parents had, some from the 1950's as well as my own from the 70's. It has been very quick and easy to use and it's very exciting to see these old pictures. I plan to put them all on DVD for my siblings and children. What a great way to preserve old memories.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It really works great! Easy!
customer_reviews.text: This Kodak slide. negative scanner works so nicely and is easy to transfer to computer. So much more efficient and the quality if negatives are in good condition ( some of ours are well over 50 years old) is quite impressive. You can correct brightness and color if needed and printing and enlarging from saved scanned negatives is above my expectations. I would recommend this to anyone whom, like I , had/ have over 300 envelopes of negatives to scan. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: nina shickle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have to read the manual to figure out how to scan and upload my old slides. It's that easy. The jpegs are about 3 mbs each so it captures good quality images limited only by the quality of the original. I didn't use an SD card. I just uploaded often. It allows you to flip the image which is helpful with slides. I haven't tried all of the features or copied anything but slides so far, but that is what I bought it for. I'm now able to get rid of the old slide magazines and projector and am able to share these old pictures with relatives. Bottom line is that I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Harrington

customer_reviews.author: Ron Ostertag

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, easy to use.

customer_reviews.author: K. Downing

customer_reviews.title: Review of Kodak Mini Digital Film Scanner

But playing around with the scanner costs nothing so a little experimentation lets you figure it out.

product_meta.title: KODAK Mini Digital Film & Slide Scanner – Converts 35mm, 126, 110, Super 8 & 8mm Film Negatives & Slides to 22 Megapixel JPEG Images – Includes - 2.4 LCD Screen – Easy Load Film Adapters
product_meta.description:
Easy Home Scanning
The main scanning device arrives with an arsenal of interchangeable adapters compatible with yesterday’s most popular film and slide formats. Specific accessories include negative and slide adapters, 110 negative film and slide trays, and a Super 8 slide tray.

Digital Done Simple
No more sophisticated computer programs or specialty machinery. Once your chosen adapter is installed, smart technology converts each slide or negative into a JPEG file that you can save via internal or external memory. Just keep loading for fast, continuous photo scanning.

Effortless Image Enhancement
You can view and edit photos right on the scanner, so there’s no need for secondary software. Once the image appears on the screen, use the flip and reverse functions to change orientation; you can also adjust brightness and RGB values for perfect coloration. Finally, certain films allow you to enhance resolution from 14 to 22 megapixels.

Full Specs & Details
- Function: Film scanner/USB MSDC
- nterface: USB 2.0
- Image Sensor: 14.0 megapixels (4416x3312); ½.33” CMOS sensor
- Display: 2.4” color TFT LCD
- Exposure Control: Automatic/Manual (-2.0 ~ +2.0 EV)
- White Balance: Automatic
- Resolution: 14 megapixels/22 megapixels*
- Scannable film types: 135 film (36 x 24mm), 126 film (27x27mm), 110 film (17 x 13mm), Super 8 film (4.01 x 5.79mm), Monochrome film, slides
- Scannable Slide formats: 35mm slides
- Scanned file format: JPEG
- TV-Out Type: NTSC/PAL
- External Memory Support: SD Card up to 32GB (Not Included)
- Power Supply: DC 5V adapter / Mini USB port
- Dimensions: 3.43” L x 3.41” W x 4.04” H
- Weight: 8.82oz


*Due to interpolation, the scanner automatically upgrades and enhances themegapixels of scanned photos from 14 – 22MP. Results not the same for all film types.

MULTIPLE ADAPTERS FOR FAST LOADING – Enjoy Maximum Compatibility & Ease of Conversion w/ a Variety of Adapters Designed for Fast, Continuous Loading; Improve Quality Up to 14/22MP w/ Adjustable Brightness, Color & Reverse/Flip
